question: You recently visited a store and did not like the customer service there. Write a letter to the store manager and say: • What was the issue there? • Why wasn't the staff helpful? • Suggest what can be done about it?
text: I am writing this letter to raise a complaint regarding the hygiene issue at one of your store.

I have been visiting to your shop frequently since I have started working from home due to the covid pandemic breakdown. The issue that I want to highlight is the dirts and stains around the frozen storage. Moreover, it is quite disgusting when people stand over and after it melts.

What is more, although I had complained to one of your staff, they never made it clean. I was wondering if you would and make some relevant training to them. It would be grateful if all of your shop clean and tidy at a level that can persuade more customers to your shop.

I would appreciate it if you could design a proper cleaning schedule and a method of deep cleaning that they must follow daily especially those areas with exposure to food. However, I trust you will give your immediate attention to this matter. Else, I will compile complaint letters to the local customer and food authority.

error_list.error_des: The singular countable noun store follows the quantifier one of, which requires a plural noun. Consider using a plural noun or a different quantifier.
The preposition to seems unecessary after the verb visiting. Consider removing the preposition.
The verb have appears to be unnecessary here.
It appears that dirts is an uncountable noun and should not be made plural. Consider changing the noun.
It appears that you are missing a comma or two with the interrupter especially those areas with exposure to food. Consider adding the comma(s).
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
